meta.subject: CHEMISTRY 5124
goals: Develop an understanding of Chemistry and its branches
Demonstrate an understanding of the particulate nature of matter
Develop investigative skills about states of matter
Demonstrate an understanding of Experimental Techniques and its application in everyday life
Develop investigative skills in experimental techniques
Demonstrate an understanding of atoms, elements, molecules and compounds.
Develop investigative skills about the nature of substances.
Demonstrate an understanding of the importance, production, use, and effect on the environment of common elements and simple compounds

specific_outcomes.description: Describe Chemistry.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: The study of matter and their chemical changes
specific_outcomes.skills: Classifying of chemistry into its branches
specific_outcomes.values: Asking questions for more understanding

specific_outcomes.description: Classify the branches of chemistry
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Branches such as: Analytical, Biochemistry, Inorganic, Physical and Organic
specific_outcomes.skills: Identifying different branches of chemistry
specific_outcomes.values: Awareness of chemistry branches

specific_outcomes.description: Explain the importance of chemistry.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Improved life through manufacture of soaps, detergents, plastic, sugar, cement, paper, medicines, food production and other life necessities
specific_outcomes.skills: Differentiating chemistry from the other natural sciences
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating chemistry

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the challenges of chemical industrial activities
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Production of undesired harmful by-products.

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an appreciation of safety in the laboratory.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Safety rules in the lab

specific_outcomes.description: Describe matter
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Anything that has mass and occupies space
specific_outcomes.skills: Classifying the basic units and states of matter
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating the basic units of matter and its existence in three states

specific_outcomes.description: Classify the basic units of matter
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Atoms ,molecules ,ions

specific_outcomes.description: Classify the states of matter.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Kinetic theory: in terms of particle arrangement and movement. Solid, liquid, gas

specific_outcomes.description: Illustrate changes of states of matter.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Changes of states such as melting, freezing, boiling, condensation, sublimation in terms of kinetic theory
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating the changes of states of matter
specific_outcomes.values: Applying changes of states of matter in everyday life

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the absorption of heat and release of heat during changes of states of matter
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Changing states of matter, exothermic-release of heat during a reaction, endothermic-absorption of heat during a reaction, include heating and cooling curves
specific_outcomes.skills: Inferring data on absorption and release of heat during changes of states of matter

specific_outcomes.description: Describe diffusion
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Movement of particles from region of higher concentration to region of lower concentration
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating the movement of particles in fluids
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating diffusion

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate diffusion in fluids
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Liquids and gases (Brownian motion)
specific_outcomes.skills: Comparing movement of particles in fluids and factors affecting their speed of movement
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the factors that affect the rate of diffusion
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Factors of diffusion E.g. molecular mass, temperature, concentration

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstratehow different quantities are measured.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Quantities such as time, temperature, mass and volume
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating accurate measurement of values of various quantities
specific_outcomes.values: Applying safety rules in use of apparatus

specific_outcomes.description: Identify different measuring apparatus used in chemistry.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Measuring apparatus such as stopwatch or stop clock, thermometers, balances, burettes, pipettes, volumetric flask, measuring cylinder, and gas syringes
specific_outcomes.skills: Identifying different measuring apparatus

specific_outcomes.description: Identify various measuring instrument and other apparatus used in chemistry
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Other apparatus: spatula, stands and clamp, test tubes, burners, , glass rods, evaporating dish, funnel beaker, conical flask etc.

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the differences between a pure substance and a mixture
specific_outcomes.knowledge: In terms of melting points and boiling points
specific_outcomes.skills: Differentiating between melting points and boiling points
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating purity of substances

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate how to determine the purity of a substance
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Sharp melting for pure substance and melting over a range of temperatures for a mixture.
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating determination of purity of substances

specific_outcomes.description: Explain the importance of purity of a substance
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Importance of purity in substances such as foodstuffs, medicines, drinks
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating the importance of purity in substances
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating of the purity of substances

specific_outcomes.description: Distinguish between physical and chemical changes
specific_outcomes.knowledge: In terms of mass changes, irreversibility/reversibility, chemical substance formed and energy involved.
specific_outcomes.skills: Analysing the components in the mixture
specific_outcomes.values: Applying separation techniques in everyday life

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate different methods of separating mixtures
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Methods such as decantation, filtration, crystallisation, simple and fractional distillation, magnetism, chromatography, evaporation, sublimation, floatation, use of separating funnel and centrifugation
specific_outcomes.skills: Identifying appropriate methods for separating different mixtures

specific_outcomes.description: Interpret simple paper chromatograms.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Uses such as Rf values and distances covered by components (restricted to paper chromatography)

specific_outcomes.description: Describe an atom and its structure.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As the smallest particle of an element which takes part in a chemical reaction. Structure: use Bohr model (nucleus at the centre surrounded by electron shells)
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating atoms, elements molecules and compounds
specific_outcomes.values: Awareness of the atomic structure

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the relative charges and approximate relative masses of protons, neutrons and electrons
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Charges as: +1,0,-1 Masses as: 1, 1, 1/1840
specific_outcomes.skills: Calculating relative atomic mass

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the proton (atomic)number and nucleon(mass) number and nuclide notation
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As number of protons: Z, number of nucleons: A (protons + neutrons)and nuclide notation   X
specific_outcomes.skills: Calculating relative atomic mass
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork

specific_outcomes.description: Describe an element
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As substance made up of same chemical atoms.
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating elements and the periodic table
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating elements from the environment

specific_outcomes.description: Identify elements using their chemical symbols
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Symbols of the elements with atomic number 1 up to 20 and other common elements in the local environment

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the basis of the Periodic Table
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Group determined by valence electrons Period determined by number of shells

specific_outcomes.description: Describe isotopes
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As atoms with same number of protons but different numbers of neutrons, including radioactive and non radioactive isotopes
specific_outcomes.skills: Calculating relative atomic mass of an element
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork

specific_outcomes.description: Calculate relative atomic mass of an element given the % abundances of isotopes and from mass spectrum.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As sum of the products of the percentages and their mass numbers

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the use of radioactive isotopes
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Such as in medical treatment of cancer, industrial use as tracers
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating the uses of isotopes
specific_outcomes.values: Awareness of the uses of isotopes

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate the build-up of electrons in shells
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Electronic configuration of atoms (spdf configuration is NOT required)

specific_outcomes.description: Describe a compound
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As substance formed from two or more elements chemically combined
specific_outcomes.skills: Classifying ionic compounds and covalent compounds
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating the use of ionic compounds and covalent compounds

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the formation of ions (radicals).
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Cations by electron loss, anions by electron gain.

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the formation of ionic (electrovalent) bonds.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Electrovalent bonding as loss and gain of electrons between metallic and non metallic atoms. Ionic bonds as electrostatic force between cations and anions. Such as NaCl, CaCl2 and MgO

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the formation of covalent bonds
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Covalent bonding as sharing of electrons between non-metallic atoms. Covalent bonds as shared pairs of electrons. Such as H2, Cl2,H2O, NH3, CH4, HCl, C2H6
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating the formation of covalent bonds
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the electronic arrangement in simple multiple covalent molecules
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Such as double bonds in O2,C2H4andCO2, Triple bond in N2and C2H2
specific_outcomes.skills: Inferring the arrangements of simple multiple covalent molecules

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the uses of ionic and covalent compounds
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As refractory materials for ionic compounds (CaO) and polar and nonpolar solvents for covalent compounds.
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating the uses of ionic and covalent compounds
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork Appreciating ionic and covalent compounds

specific_outcomes.description: Describe a molecule
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As the smallest particle of an element or compound which exists independently.

specific_outcomes.description: Describe valency and valence electrons.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Valency as combining power of an atom or radical. Valence electrons as the number of electrons in the outer most shell.
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating the deducing of valency
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate how to deduce valency of an element.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: From the formula of a compound, ionic charge, valence electrons.

specific_outcomes.description: Formulate chemical formulae of compounds.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Using valency and chemical symbols of elements, charges on ions, models, relative numbers of atoms present, diagrammatic representation
specific_outcomes.skills: Formulating chemical formulae
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more Fostering teamwork Appreciating ionic and covalent compounds

specific_outcomes.description: Identify the differences in properties of ionic and covalent compounds.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Differences such as volatility, electrical conductivity, density, melting point, boiling point and basic units.
specific_outcomes.skills: Differentiating chemical formulae Investigating properties of ionic and covalent compounds

specific_outcomes.description: Describe metallic bonding
specific_outcomes.knowledge: As lattice of positive ions in a ‘sea’ of delocalised electrons
specific_outcomes.skills: Communicating metallic bonding and thermal conductivity
specific_outcomes.values: Asking more questions to learn more

specific_outcomes.description: Describe the electrical and thermal conductivity of metals
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Due to free electron movement/delocalised electrons

specific_outcomes.description: Demonstrate how to construct word equations.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Equation showing reactants and products separated by a full curled arrow (⇒).
specific_outcomes.skills: Demonstrating construction of word equations
specific_outcomes.values: Appreciating the conservation of matter.

specific_outcomes.description: Formulate and balance chemical equations.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Number of atoms of each element being equal on both sides of the equation. Balancing can be done by inspection. Equations may include state symbols (s-solid, l – liquid, g – gas, aq – aqueous).
specific_outcomes.skills: Formulating balanced chemical and ionic equations.

specific_outcomes.description: Construct net ionic equations from balanced chemical equations.
specific_outcomes.knowledge: Only ionic aqueous reactants/products must be broken down into their respective ions then cancel out spectator ions to come up with net ionic equation.
